title: Enhancing Media Literacy in the Digital Age: Integrated Online Learning Course on Language-Based Critical Thinking and Practice

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital device usage experience, everyday media consumption habits, foundational grammar understanding and text comprehension abilities, and basic vocabulary application skills
context.additional_context: A practical learning environment for cultivating media literacy in smartphone-centric, technology-constrained settings. Simultaneously emphasizes linguistic expression and critical thinking, aiming to improve writing/reading skills. Particularly develops comprehensive language competencies for the digital age through text analysis, vocabulary selection, and grammatical structure utilization.

learning_goals: Learners select 3 news articles, 2 YouTube videos, and 5 SNS posts, analyze them via a linguistic framework (fact-checking, source credibility, logical fallacy classification), identify errors with ≥80% accuracy, and write a 1,000-character report critically interpreting media intent through structural and lexical pattern analysis.

Learners propose personal information protection and digital citizenship practices in social media with linguistic strategies (empathic messaging, objective descriptions, persuasive vocabulary), emphasizing grammatically accurate sentences and appropriate word choice.

Learners create 3 media production/sharing scenarios (e.g., SNS posts, YouTube videos, blog articles) meeting ≥4/5 ethical checklist items (copyright, privacy, misinformation, hate speech, citations), achieving ≥80% peer evaluation suitability. They demonstrate clear communication via lexical selection and grammar, integrating reading comprehension and expression skills for ethical media solutions.

resources: Smartphone filming equipment for video lectures
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
